citations.narrative:
The maximum number of animals authorized for the licensee’s USDA license is 100 animals, but they currently have 222
animals. The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure the facility is capable of providing care for
that number of animals.
A licensee must obtain a new license before any change resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand
at any single point in time during the period of licensure. The licensee must maintain no more than the maximum number
of animals that their USDA license allows.
Correction date by: December 25, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a plan for the environmental enhancement to promote psychological well-being for the birds.
The facility displays, two ostriches, 6 rheas, 5 emus, and 2 Amazon parrots, all of which are provided with enrichments to
enhance their environments and promote their health and well-being. A developed plan has not been documented and
reviewed by the attending veterinarian. Facility must develop and document and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement for its birds. The attending veterinarian should review, make adjustments to, and approve an
appropriate plan.
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by
the attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides.
Correction date by: December 16, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Robert Ferguson, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(i) 
   
Requirements and application 
The maximum number of animals authorized for the licensee’s USDA license is 100 animals, but they currently have 222 
animals. The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure the facility is capable of providing care for 
that number of animals.  
A licensee must obtain a new license before any change resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand 
at any single point in time during the period of licensure. The licensee must maintain no more than the maximum number 
of animals that their USDA license allows.  
 
Correction date by: December 25, 2024. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not have a plan for the environmental enhancement to promote psychological well-being for the birds. 
The facility displays, two ostriches, 6 rheas, 5 emus, and 2 Amazon parrots, all of which are provided with enrichments to 
enhance their environments and promote their health and well-being. A developed plan has not been documented and 
reviewed by the attending veterinarian. Facility must develop and document and follow a species-appropriate plan for 
environment enhancement for its birds. The attending veterinarian should review, make adjustments to, and approve an 
appropriate plan. 
 
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for 
environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by 
the attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted 
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. 
 
Correction date by: December 16, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.

Additional Inspectors: 
Robert Ferguson, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
